      #include <string>
#include <iostream>

class Person
{
private:
	  std::string m_name; 

public:
    Person(const std::string & name_in = "No Name")  // ìƒì„±ì. ë””í´íŠ¸ ê°’ì´ ìˆìœ¼ë¯€ë¡œ ì¸ìˆ˜ ì—†ì´ í˜¸ì¶œí•´ë„ ëœë‹¤.
        :m_name(name_in)
    {}

    void setName(const std::string & name_in)
    {
        m_name = name_in;
    }

    std::string getName() const
    {
        return m_name;
    }

    void doSomething()
    {
        cout << "Person!" << endl;
    }
};

    • ğŸ“œ Person 
      #include <string>
#include <iostream>

class Person
{
private:
	  std::string m_name; 

public:
    Person(const std::string & name_in = "No Name")
        :m_name(name_in)
    {}

    void setName(const std::string & name_in)
    {
        m_name = name_in;
    }

    std::string getName() const
    {
        return m_name;
    }

    void doSomething()
    {
        cout << "Person!" << endl;
    }
};
    • ğŸ“œ Student 
      #pragma once

{

  void doSomething()  // â­ì˜¤ë²„ë¼ì´ë”©â­
  {
      cout << "Student!" << endl;  // ë‚´ìš©ì„ ë°”ê¿¨ë‹¤.
  }

    • ğŸ“œ Person 
      #include <string>
#include <iostream>

class Person
{
private:
	  std::string m_name; 

public:
    Person(const std::string & name_in = "No Name")
        :m_name(name_in)
    {}

    void setName(const std::string & name_in)
    {
        m_name = name_in;
    }

    std::string getName() const
    {
        return m_name;
    }

    void doSomething()
    {
        cout << m_name << endl;
    }
};
    • ğŸ“œ Student 
      #pragma once

  void doSomething()  
  {
      cout << m_name << endl;  // âŒì—ëŸ¬âŒ
  }
};

      #pragma once

class Student : public Person
{
